intro: Flagellaria guineensis, commonly known as the African flagellaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in small heads. The plant is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
